intro: Epacris breviflora, commonly known as the dwarf fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Epacris breviflora is a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
